App description:
Have you ever felt like you were living in a ceaseless repetition? Set within a scale model of 1940s So Paulo, The Line is a 15-20 minute interactive story about love and fear of change, allowing you to unlock an enchanted miniature model of two miniature dolls, Pedro and Rosa.

This roomscale experience invites you to pull on knobs and even crawl under the machinery  to unfold the story of these figurines who are perfect for each other but reluctant to live out their love. 

"The Line" is great to showcase VR for first-time users. 
Narrated by Rodrigo Santoro (Westworld) and directed by Ricardo Laganaro, The Line was awarded the Best VR Experience prize at the 76th Venice International Film Festival. 

Additional modes: 
Hand Tracking: Using your own hands for natural interaction -Room scale and seated mode: Freely around the scale model, or experience the story around you for those with limited space or reduced mobility.

Narration and SDH subtitles in English and Portuguese.

A neat way to tell a story ...

Very short, lightly interactive; this amazingly charming love story plays out like an old-fashion diorama. The tongue in cheek nature of the story taking place in the environment was delightful and fun.

Just reviewed Gloomy Eyes - and like that, this isn't an experience for everyone. It isn't a game; it isn't even really an experience - but a story told in a fresh, neat way.

If you liked this, get Gloomy Eyes too - likewise if you liked that? This is shorter, but just as enchanting to experience.

VR doesn't have to be all gun-porn and e-sports.

Better than I was expecting :)

I really enjoyed this app. The story is cute. It's short and there isn't a lot to do but there are buttons to push, levers to pull, knobs to turn and you are walking a little bit, a few steps now and again to get to the next part of the story. You start by sitting on the floor and you end up down on the floor for a minute at another point as this is where the story takes you. You can do this sitting down or standing up. I stood up while the story played out and had no issues with balance.

Some may take issue with paying money for such a short experience that they may only watch once but it is really cheap and I feel, it's worth it. I actually ran through it a couple of times. This is also something you can let someone else who maybe isn't familiar with VR try out for themselves.

A Short beautifully animated love story

REVIEW IS ALSO AVAILABLE SPOILER FREE ON YOUTUBE BY SEARCHING Gamertag VR

The Line from ARVORE is a magically short story of love, making excellent use of the hand tracking technology found on the oculus quest and I really hope we see more developers making use of it to tell interactive stories this way.

The presentation is excellent with regards to music sound effects and is also complemented by Rodrigo Santoro mostly known from Westworld as your narrator. All this adds up to feeling like a high quality piece of VR story telling and has Toy Story like moments.
